Content:
Hey, I'm making a bike out of a chainsaw. Are these specs enough for it to produce enough power? Looking to ride it on a long stretch of
level bike paths so I can get around without having to use a car (I'm doing a driving test in a week) I know you might think I'm crazy, retarded or both,
but I find the idea of making your own bike pretty sick.

Here are the specs

engine:
two-stroke

engine displacement:
49.3 cm3

maximum torque:
2.8 Nm

nominal power output:
1.9 kW

rotational speed:
10300 rpm

chain thickness:
1.5 mm

chain speed @ max power output:
20.8 m/s




weight:

6 kg


Don't tell me "it's illegal" Yeah I know, it's gonna be my personal project and either way I'm going to make it. I'm gonna cover
the chainsaw with these black pouches you see on bulky BMW motorbikes so when I see the cops I can just turn the saw off.

Also here's a pic of what the chainsaw looks like (I got an older model but it was the same price)




God bless y'all

Title: Making a bike out of a chainsaw
Author: effefe
